programme.desc: The story of Margaret Haig Thomas, one of Wales' most prominent suffragettes, the shy girl from Monmouthshire who became a militant campaigner for the vote for women. During a lifetime of adventure 'Lady Rhondda' survived the sinking of RMS Lusitania, was jailed for planting a chemical bomb in Newport, and went on hunger strike in support of her political views. She also became one of the most successful businesswomen of her time. She has her heart set on it being geared primarily towards her young son, with several bold ideas about how it will look, whereas her best friend thinks a more mature, adult orientated space is perhaps more suitable

programme.title: Escape to the Country

Alistair also spends an exhilarating day at the University of Bath as he launches himself on to the UK's only bobsleigh and skeleton push-start track

programme.title: The Bidding Room

His Evel Knievel doll and Stunt World canyon jump is both complete and rare, and he hopes to use its nostalgic qualities to help him leap towards a stellar sale. Ashley appears with a hand-painted 6ft-long tuna that he wants to sell so he can buy a fibreglass gorilla. Michelle presents a mid-20th century chair linked to famous designer Ingmar Relling, which she bought from a junk shop for 15

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones co-hosts the live magazine show, featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Drastic times call for drastic measures for Stacey as the bills pile high, and Nish quizzes Suki about her time with Eve in Leeds. Amy is in trouble at home when she is caught trying to steal booze from Peggy's

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett face another selection of hopeful entrepreneurs. A duo offering activity-packed weekend breaks for adults turn one of the Dragons into an unhappy camper. Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Stacey Dooley: Ready for War?
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a few tiny specks of grey paint help to solve not one, but two, brutal axe murders. Plus, how a bungling burglar was caught when his DNA is discovered on a rock used to smash a window. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Thorn the giraffe is having problems with his hooves, but for the vet to get close enough to fix them he needs to be within kicking distance of the giant animal. Elsewhere in the park, another team of vets prepares to perform a procedure on a pair of male reindeer. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development progress of properties in Burnley and Lowestoft, as well as a Shropshire cottage that Martin Roberts has fallen in love with

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Nick Hall and Tim Weeks assist the red and blue teams as they shop for bargains in Detling, Kent. Presenter Caroline Hawley monitors the contest and also visits Bekonscot, the oldest model village in the world

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Al does something shocking to save his daughter's skin while the police are called out to investigate the vandalism of a remote cottage that belonged to Mrs Yorke only to discover Denis Crofter fixing the damage

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Bedford call on the help of interior designer Russell Sage and the Virtual Reality design studio for advice on how to resolve their differences on what to do with their new extension area, which is currently very white and uninspired

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor helps a Suffolk house-hunter with his quest to find a low-maintenance rural home with a wildlife-friendly garden, on a 490,000 budget. Margherita also turns her attention to the county's maritime heritage when she gets hands-on with traditional skills and techniques at Suffolk's International Boatbuilding Training College

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Peter appears with a 1960s battery-operated tin tugboat, hoping to captivate buyers with its performance. Nicola presents a vintage petrol pump restored by her father. This 1940s piece is in great condition and she uses this virtue to drive a hard bargain with the five dealers. Raj offers up a set of stylish and functional stools, while Rachel showcases two charming funfair dolphins. Nigel Havers hosts

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.desc: England striker Ellen White, world 1500m champion Jake Wightman, Grand National-winning former jockey Mick Fitzgerald and Olympic boxing medallist Anthony Ogogo join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The first quarter-final sees this week's most talented four cooks return to contest a place in the semi-finals. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by last year's series finalists and champion, namely Eddie Scott, Pookie Tredell and Radha Kaushal-Bolland. Only the best cooks can earn themselves a place in knockout week, so these amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to the 2023 trophy

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Charlie Brooker hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with comedian Miles Jupp and journalist Charlotte Ivers acting as guest panellists alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. Collectively, all concerned poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a stately home for his latest cleaning task. He's not the only person at the mansion with a job to do - there's a shaman on the scene as well, and he has his own mystical agenda. Wicky's not sure there's room enough for both of them - and after an owl and possibly a ghost are factored into the mix, things are looking positively crowded. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Alex Lawther

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Give It a Year (2013)
programme.desc: A couple marry after a whirlwind romance, but family and friends have doubts about the relationship. As their first anniversary approaches, they both begin to wonder if they are right for each other, especially when faced with more appealing alternative partners. Romantic comedy, with Rose Byrne, Rafe Spall, Anna Faris and Simon Baker

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Nathan Outlaw and Alison Roman, with special guest Nina Wadia. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates some easy celebration bakes, including a glittering meringue layer cake, a slow-cooked lamb curry fit for a feast, a traditional Eastern European sweet bread known as babka and an American inspired seafood extravaganza. She also meets award-winning macaron maker Naeem Mohamed, who shares his astonishing macaron stack cake

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including West Ham United v Arsenal. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Aston Villa and Newcastle United

programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring Luca Brecel and Neil Robertson's first-round matches against qualifiers. Brecel has never progressed beyond the first round, while Robertson was a champion in 2010

programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of this afternoon's results from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Dr Hilary Jones, TV presenter Danni Menzies, drag queen Kitty Scott-Claus and actor Niamh McGrady are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on the discovery of penicillin, rally driver Rosemary Smith, Girls Aloud, and Bluey

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as daytime TV stars Fern Britton, Owain Wyn Evans, Naga Munchetty, Charlie Stayt, Mr Motivator, Carol McGiffin, Diarmuid Gavin and Dr Punam Krishan try to win 50,000 for charity

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy quiz show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. With Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Mari Wilson, Jaki Graham, Ruthie Henshall, Kerry Ellis, Carrie Grant, David Grant, Nicola Stephenson and Charlie Condou try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jan is shocked to recognise a drunk and homeless patient suffering from trench foot as her ex-husband, and discovers to her horror that she is still listed as his next of kin. Max issues a challenge - whichever new nurse has the most impressive shift will win a prize - and Dylan accidentally makes Donna's life much harder when she comes to the aid of a patient collapsed in the car park

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan finds herself under pressure to make decisions about her future, as CityWorld need to know if she wants to be CEO but Andreas wants to go back to Crete. She is still determined to find the missing last chapter of Alan Conway's book, and her suspicions are further aroused about his untimely end

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Newcastle United at Villa Park and Manchester City v Leicester City. United continued their bid for a top-four place away to the mid-table Villans, while the Citizens will have expected three points to aid their title-challenge when they entertained struggling Leicester

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer present a countdown of some of the many fine French players to have graced the Premier League

programme.title: The Place Beyond the Pines (2012)
programme.desc: A motorcycle stunt rider is reunited with his lost love and the son he has never met. He gives up his life on the road to support them, but ends up drawn into crime, attracting the attention of a troubled, ambitious cop and setting in motion a conflict that will have unforeseen consequences for both men's children. Crime drama, starring Ryan Gosling and Bradley Cooper

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps a buyer find a new lease on life in the countryside. Now her sons have fledged the nest, today's buyer has her sights on Devon or Dorset

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers enter the Bidding Room. First in is Jack with some 1940 stained-glass library dividers followed by Geoff with a racing tricycle. Terri and Natalie bring a chest full of Sindy house furniture and Kevin presents the dealers with an interesting painting linked to a famous artist. Last in is Caroline with a vintage copper milking machine

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox returns with the programme that celebrates the joy of books and reading, and is joined by guests Angela Scanlon, DJ Spoony, Rob Rinder and Cerys Matthews. They all bring their favourite books to champion, and review this week's book club choices of In the Blink of an Eye by Jo Callaghan, and Burial Rites by Hannah Kent

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood highlights innovative methods used to catch criminals. A mother arrives home with her newborn baby, only for masked burglars to smash in, and a dashcam reveals a van driver's criminal behaviour before a crash

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the remaining 17 contestants to compete for a possible 10,000 jackpot. Right answers take them closer to the big money, but if at any stage they give an Impossible answer, they will immediately be knocked out. Quiz, hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Live Gymnastics
programme.desc: Matt Baker presents the men's all-around event from Antalya, Turkey, as Europe's best male gymnasts showcase their intricate and explosive acrobatic moves in a bid to be crowned continental champion. Joe Fraser made history in Munich last summer by becoming the first British male gymnast to win the coveted title. Fresh from winning three gold medals at his hometown Commonwealth Games, the Birmingham gymnast impressed across all six apparatus, scoring top on parallel bars and pommel horse

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Tara can only build temporary structures on a piece of Wiltshire land she inherited. Using a reassembled corrugated metal shed, Simon devises a plan to create a tiny off-grid eco shed that will be a unique place to stay

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team are at Glemham Hall in the Suffolk countryside, where David Fletcher spots a rare flintlock pistol, and James Lewis uncovers a copy of a Raphael painting

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge skills ahead of the final on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Cerys Matthews check in and chef Alex accompanies the musician, author and radio host to a local farm, whose owners Richard and Leona have a passion for turning rapeseed flowers into delicious, flavoured oils. Cerys and Alex take some of the oils back to the B&B to enhance the evening meal. While most guests start their morning at the B&B with a challenge, host Sharon helps Cerys fulfil a lifelong wish to visit the Giant's Causeway

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Veteran Tony comes to the workshop to tell Jay about fellow veteran Paul, who suffered problems such as homelessness when he left the forces. Paul went on to set up a charity in Hull to help other former service men and women with things like housing and food. The charity plans to build the world's first veteran's village, featuring 48 homes. Tony would like Jay and his team to come up with something for Paul's office. Also visiting the workshop is Lesley. She comes to tell Jay about Edgar and Elizabeth, who fostered her when she was a teenager. Lesley says they helped turn her life around and that she and her family now feel like a part of theirs, something she wasn't expecting as a young person growing up in the care system. Edgar and Elizabeth have gone on to foster 130 children

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: The Fabs were the first all-female group from Wales, brought together inspired by the success of the Beatles. Breaking through in a male-dominated industry was difficult in the 1960s, but Swedish boy band Moonlighters recognised their talents and left a big impression on the girls. Now more than five decades later, members of both bands enjoy a much-anticipated reunion. Plus, ex-addict Simon meets the man who turned his life around and Ellie thanks a teacher who was her rock following a terror attack. Presented by Alex Jones

programme.title: Brian Cox: Seven Days on Mars
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox fulfils a childhood dream by going behind the scenes at Nasa's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), mission control for Mars 2020 - one of the most ambitious missions ever launched, which may finally reveal if life has ever existed on the Red Planet. In 1980, a young Brian Cox wrote to JPL asking for photos from some of their missions to the planets. The pictures they sent him from Voyager and the Viking mission to Mars were a source of inspiration that set him on the path to becoming a physicist

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe
programme.desc: The comedian returns with her travelogue in which she tracks down the world's most endangered jobs and crafts. She begins in Greece, where she meets the last monk in a monastery, a family of church bell-makers, and villagers who communicate by whistling to one another

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Seventy six-year-old Barry is on the cardiac ward, waiting for a double bypass - but a shortage of beds means his operation has already been cancelled twice in two weeks. Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans is hoping it will be third time lucky today as she prepares to take him into theatre. Others hoping their operations will go ahead are 57-year-old Dawn, who is having a cancerous tumour removed from her brain, and 15-year-old Jack, who has waited more than a year to correct his curved spine

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: W Kamau Bell's documentary about Bill Cosby's descent from 'America's Dad' to alleged sexual predator examines how the actor and comedian's reputation evolved in the 1970s, when he became an on-screen educator and moral authority - a man thought to be trustworthy

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Frida and Diego travel to San Francisco where he has an important mural commission. Her style stirs much excitement, and Frida is determined to succeed in her own right in the face of Diego's affairs. Shocked by the vast gap between rich and poor that she witnesses in Depression-era New York, she struggles to hide her disdain for high society

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer with a budget of 260,000 to escape her small flat near Heathrow for some much needed peace and quiet in the Wiltshire countryside

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Stunt man David turns up with the 1976 toy that inspired his career. His Evel Knievel doll and Stunt World canyon jump is both complete and rare, and he hopes to use its nostalgic qualities to help him leap towards a stellar sale. Ashley appears with a hand-painted 6ft-long tuna that he wants to sell so he can buy a fibreglass gorilla. Michelle presents a mid-20th century chair linked to famous designer Ingmar Relling, which she bought from a junk shop for 15

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don and the team are back with a celebration of spring. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, the host will be planting clematis and rocket, cutting back grasses and making a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer. Plus, Carol Klein visits Colesbourne Gardens in Gloucestershire to revel in their vibrant displays of spring colour

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers end their pub tour in Carlisle where they learn about an extraordinary First World War government scheme designed to put a stop to drunken behaviour by taking over and controlling all the pubs and breweries. The duo discover what the scheme did and how it changed Carlisle's pubs for ever

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Live Gymnastics
programme.desc: Matt Baker introduces live coverage from Turkey as the finalists in the women's all-around event perform routines marrying grace and strength in a bid to be recognised as the best in Europe. Great Britain has enjoyed medal success in this four-apparatus event in the recent past, with Alice Kinsella winning silver behind Italy's Asia D'Amato last summer and Jessica Gadirova earning bronze in 2021

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Leonora is a 16-year-old orangutan who has been living in a commune on a protected island run by the Borneo Orangutan Survival Foundation. This documentary follows Leonora and her three-year-old infant Lemar as they undertake an epic and life-changing journey by boat, road and finally helicopter, before being released into the rainforest

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: In Dorset, musicians Ralph and Dizzy live on a farm with extended family and run woodland workshops in their bender, a simple shelter made from hazel sticks. They want to make the existing structure more attractive to paying customers and have asked Simon Parfett and his team to help build it

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A special edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series and bringing brand new valuations and unexpected auctions. Plus, presenter Paul Martin goes behind the scenes of Bamburgh Castle in Northumberland to see just what it takes to keep the building alive

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge skills and keep their eyes on the prize before the winner is announced

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Former England rugby union player Ugo Monye checks in to the 19th-century Victorian villa eager to get stuck in with all the challenges the team can throw at him. His first task is seeing if he can hopefully bring in the catch of the day. The cold Northern Atlantic waters are to thank for providing Northern Ireland with spectacular seafood and on this trip, they're fishing for scallops. With the fresh catch, chef Alex is hoping to put Ugo to work in the kitchen preparing braised fennel, nduja and scallop stew

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the borderlands of Radnorshire, searching for nesting birds along the Wye, dormice and roe deer in its woodlands. He also finds yellowhammers on Offa's Dyke

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: It's a busy time in the garden, sowing and planting for the summer to come. This year's first early potatoes get started, and there's a trial of tomato plants suited to windowsill-growing. Calum Clunie checks out how the bulbs he bought from a range of supermarkets last year have developed, and Kirsty Wilson looks at the selection, care and display of houseplants

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for late spring and summer, sowing poppies and planting cornflowers for colour and interest in the Paradise Garden. Toby Buckland revels in some fabulous spring planting on a visit to the magnificent, landscaped gardens of Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a passionate dahlia grower who was once a florist working at the White House for President Obama and the First Lady

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Continuing their travels are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight. The pilgrims wake up in the village of Vitorino Dos Piaes in Northern Portugal, and decide to make a quick detour to The Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Monte

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: Philomena Cunk continues her historical odyssey by examining the Victorian era with help from guests including naturalist and broadcaster Chris Packham, who tries to shed some light on Charles Darwin's discoveries and theories. Spoof documentary, starring Diane Morgan

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The NYPD investigates multiple leads regarding the murder of Nick De Noia, with possible motives including a love triangle, insurance fraud, or an angry boss - all of which lead nowhere. Years later, the FBI receives a tip from a hitman known as Strawberry, which blows the case wide open

programme.title: Christine McGuinness: Unmasking My Autism
programme.desc: In 2021, 33-year-old mother of three Christine McGuinness discovered she was autistic, and for the first time her life began to make sense. There are thousands of women in the UK who have been battling with undiagnosed autism for decades. Christine sets out on a journey of self-discovery, asking why it took so long before she received a diagnosis and the impact it has had on her life. She also asks how many other women out there have been let down too and what can be done to improve the lives of autistic women and girls? She meets with other women who have had similar experiences

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Two-part documentary in which co-presenters Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha, along with others of Jewish and Palestinian heritage, explore how their families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They begin by meeting a father and son who follow in the footsteps of their ancestor, who became caught up in Israel's War of Independence, and a woman whose grandmother survived one of the most notorious episodes of the Nakba

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The teams make over different classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire - one for babies, one for toddlers and another for three to five-year-olds. Each room must feature different areas to accommodate various activities and safety is the key, and while dominates most of their plans, one team controversially opts for a shade of beige. What will Michele Ogundehin and guest judge Sophie Robinson think of the end results?

programme.title: Live Gymnastics
programme.desc: Coverage of the fifth and penultimate day from Antalya in Turkey, as medals are decided in the apparatus finals

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Wales v England (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the opening match in the third round of fixtures, held at Cardiff Arms Park. Wales have impressed so far with victories over Ireland and Scotland, while reigning champions England are also undefeated so after comfortable wins against the Scots and Italy

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the afternoon session on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring Luca Brecel and Neil Robertson's first-round matches against qualifiers

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester United Women v Brighton & Hove Albion Women (Kick-off 5.15pm). All the action from the FA Cup semi-final at Leigh Sports Village. Both teams are facing a top-flight opponent for the first time in this season's competition, but United will go into the match as favourites given they are also battling it out for glory in the Women's Super League, while Brighton have struggled so far this term. Whichever of these sides progress to the final will then appear in the showpiece match for the first time in club history, and will meet the winner of tomorrow's semi-final between Aston Villa Women and Chelsea Women, the latter of whom are reigning champions

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the Vale of Mowbray pork pie factory in Northallerton, Yorkshire, where the traditional pastries have been made since 1928. Gregg finds out which cuts of pork are used and is shown how to make the hot water pastry that acts as a strong 'container' for the pork filling. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey reveals hacks for the perfect vegan short crust pastry and takes to the wheel to learn how to drive one of the HGVs transporting food products around the country every day

programme.title: Carole King and Her Songs at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the American singer-songwriter, with a collection of performances of her songs, both by King herself and by a range of other artists, taken from BBC shows from over the decades

programme.title: Carole King: Home Again - Live in Central Park
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter's triumphant May 1973 homecoming concert on the Great Lawn of New York City's Central Park before an estimated audience of 100,000. Featured songs include It's Too Late, Home Again and You've Been Around Too Long

programme.title: Carole King: Natural Woman
programme.desc: Profile of the singer-songwriter, charting her upbringing in Brooklyn and rise to become one of the most successful musicians of her generation, credited with a string of pop hits. Featuring interviews with King herself, fellow writers Barry Mann and Cynthia Weil, her daughter Sherry Goffin Kondor, manager and producer Lou Adler, lyricists Carol Bayer Sager and Toni Stern and musicians Russ Kunkel and Danny Kortchmar

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from the opening day at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring first-round matches

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: An in-depth focus on the opening day at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as the season-ending championship got under way with the best-of-19-frames first-round matches

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Continuing their travels are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight. The pilgrims wake up in the village of Vitorino Dos Piaes in Northern Portugal, and decide to make a quick detour to The Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Monte

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock presents the latest science in the hunt for exterrestrial life, visiting Professor Mark Sephton at Imperial College London - one of the scientists leading on the Perseverance Rover mission to Mars. Chris Lintott hears about the launch of a major European Space Agency mission to explore habitability on Jupiter's icy moons

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta

programme.title: The Joy of Winning
programme.desc: A witty, mind-expanding guide in which Hannah Fry unlocks the essential strategies a person needs to get what they want - to win more of the time. The mathematician also hails 20th-century scientists John von Neumann and John Nash, who worked out the science of success and reveals how the same rules apply to the world's biggest problems - whether its avoiding nuclear annihilation or tackling climate change

programme.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969)
programme.desc: Two notorious outlaws' routine of bank and train robberies is cut short when a seemingly unstoppable posse is formed to catch them. The pair plan to flee America and start a new life in Bolivia, with the Sundance Kid's schoolmistress lover in tow - but staying ahead of the law is not so easy. Western, starring Paul Newman, Robert Redford and Katharine Ross

programme.title: Blazing Saddles (1974)
programme.desc: A crooked railway tycoon whose men are terrorising a frontier town arranges for a black sheriff to be appointed, hoping the racist residents will reject him. The lawman proves more cunning than expected, and with the help of a drunken gunslinger, runs rings around the businessman. Mel Brooks' Western spoof, in which he co-stars alongside Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder and Madeline Kahn

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits the north of Britain to look at the most fascinating archaeology uncovered in the region over the course of 2021. In North Yorkshire, a team of community volunteers are digging down beneath Richmond Castle. On the northern tip of the Orkney Islands, the dig diary cameras are present to witness archaeologists racing to unearth rare discoveries from an endangered Neolithic tomb before it erodes into the sea. And 10 miles east of Edinburgh, volunteers are hunting for evidence of Scotland's oldest railway

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto visits Rome, the hilltop town of Tivoli and Naples, where he explores the city's subterranean tunnels and dodges its notoriously dangerous local motorists. He also stops off at the Galleria Borghese, and the water gardens at Villa d'Este, before meeting a family whose members live near the steaming sulphur jets of Solfatara

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Since its launch in April 1990, the Hubble space telescope has made more than 1.5 million observations of the universe. One of the most productive scientific instruments in history, over the past three decades it has transformed man's view of the cosmos. This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe

programme.title: Top of the Pops

Eager Beaver puts her hand up and says that if she is picked, they will break the record for the most fun things done in one day. The Elders are impressed and Elder Kitten announces that Eager Beaver will be the leader for the day. But Eager Beaver becomes so determined to break the fun record that she bosses her friends around.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Its the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. Love Monster realises that she is right and starts beatboxing. The Fluffytowners start having fun again and begin cheering for him.

programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Macks Stall. She chooses the photo of Bob and Ted and remembers the day she got it. When Bobs identical twin, Ted, arrives at the Big Hub for a visit, Molly and Mack cant believe how alike they are. Bob and Ted tell them how they used to pretend to be one another when they were boys. This gives Molly an idea! Bob and Ted could play the same trick again, on everyone in the Hub. Soon, Molly and Bob are up on the balcony watching Ted pretending to be Bob at his stall. At first, the plan goes well, but things soon start to go wrong. Ted gets everyones names mixed up and he doesnt know his plums from his apricots. Finally, when Moira asks Bob to fix her spinny chair, we discover that Ted is a bit useless at mending things, and the game is most definitely up!

And Chantelle joins Aneeshwar, who is a keen bird watcher - together they try to spot a puffling, a baby puffin, in the cliffs. Chantelle and Rorys fact files help answer all of Emilys questions. With the help of the special poem, we discover that like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, puffins are superheroes, helping our planet in their own special way. And for this episodes Teeny Tiny Task, Rory and Sandy decide to be 'more puffin' and decorate each others faces with faceprints.

Dr Amit and Kika have an important mission to pick up a surprise cake and some party hats from the supermarket for Aunty Ninas birthday. Kika has lots of friends at the supermarket. But first, she must use her supersight - and the help of her tiny friends, the road cones - to guide Dr Amit past the roadworks and keep him safely on the pavement. Then she has to help Dr Amit pick up the cake from the supermarket bakery and find the party hats. But the party hats have been moved! Kika must use all her powers to find them. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: Long-serving driver Jason Bennett, aka Block, is a special mission, meeting up with best mate and veteran ex-trucker Duncan. They've got a busy day ahead, getting Duncan's collection of vintage trucks in tip-top condition ready for one of the highlights of the trucking calendar - the Builth Wells Truck Show. Meanwhile, mechanic Murph's on the hunt for a faulty valve and new driver Laura battles with the elements

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Wales v England (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the opening match in the third round of fixtures, held at Cardiff Arms Park. Wales have impressed so far with victories over Ireland and Scotland, while reigning champions England are also undefeated so after comfortable wins against the Scots and Italy

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Wales v England (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the opening match in the third round of fixtures, held at Cardiff Arms Park. Wales have impressed so far with victories over Ireland and Scotland, while reigning champions England are also undefeated so after comfortable wins against the Scots and Italy

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of this afternoon's results from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England striker Ellen White, world 1500m champion Jake Wightman, Grand National-winning former jockey Mick Fitzgerald and Olympic boxing medallist Anthony Ogogo join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Dr Hilary Jones, TV presenter Danni Menzies, drag queen Kitty Scott-Claus and actor Niamh McGrady are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on the discovery of penicillin, rally driver Rosemary Smith, Girls Aloud, and Bluey

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as daytime TV stars Fern Britton, Owain Wyn Evans, Naga Munchetty, Charlie Stayt, Mr Motivator, Carol McGiffin, Diarmuid Gavin and Dr Punam Krishan try to win 50,000 for charity

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Mari Wilson, Jaki Graham, Ruthie Henshall, Kerry Ellis, Carrie Grant, David Grant, Nicola Stephenson and Charlie Condou try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jan is shocked to recognise a drunk and homeless patient suffering from trench foot as her ex-husband, and discovers to her horror that she is still listed as his next of kin. Max issues a challenge - whichever new nurse has the most impressive shift will win a prize - and Dylan accidentally makes Donna's life much harder when she comes to the aid of a patient collapsed in the car park

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan finds herself under pressure to make decisions about her future, as CityWorld need to know if she wants to be CEO but Andreas wants to go back to Crete. She is still determined to find the missing last chapter of Alan Conway's book, and her suspicions are further aroused about his untimely end

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Newcastle United at Villa Park and Manchester City v Leicester City. United continued their bid for a top-four place away to the mid-table Villans, while the Citizens will have expected three points to aid their title-challenge when they entertained struggling Leicester

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer present a countdown of some of the many fine French players to have graced the Premier League

programme.title: The Place Beyond the Pines (2012)
programme.desc: A motorcycle stunt rider is reunited with his lost love and the son he has never met. He gives up his life on the road to support them, but ends up drawn into crime, attracting the attention of a troubled, ambitious cop and setting in motion a conflict that will have unforeseen consequences for both men's children. Crime drama, starring Ryan Gosling and Bradley Cooper

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How the discovery of a car buried deep within a scrapper's yard proved the key to unlocking the riddle of who was responsible for a suspected gangland shooting at a secluded location. Plus, how tracking a car wash owner's phone connected him to modern-day slavery. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: One of the park's favourite couples, armadillos Preston and Polly, are due to be reunited to have another litter. However the keepers make a worrying discovery - Polly is bleeding and they need to figure out what's making her sick. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh heads to Stockport, Greater Manchester, to see a two-bed mid-terrace with a considerable damp problem. Martin Roberts is just outside Stoke-on-Trent, where even getting over the threshold of a two-bed mid-terrace is ill-advised. The programme also revisits Milton in Staffordshire, where in 2021 Dion Dublin saw a mixed residential and commercial auction lot

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Danny Sebastian go antique hunting with two teams at the Royal Cheshire Showground, while presenter Eric Knowles heads to Knutsford's penny farthing museum

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: A look at how one switch of the visa rules left many with their trips hanging in the balance, and the holidaymakers refused travel when their passports were perfectly valid. Plus, Simon Calder shares his best budget breaks

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A mother of a young toddler calls on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to breath some life and vibrancy into a dull dining space. She has her heart set on it being geared primarily towards her young son, with several bold ideas about how it will look, whereas her best friend thinks a more mature, adult orientated space is perhaps more suitable

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton guides a pair of budding entrepreneurs who want to escape to the Cotswolds. They have a generous 900,000 to play with, but the property must have the potential to develop a boutique country holiday let. Alistair also spends an exhilarating day at the University of Bath as he launches himself on to the UK's only bobsleigh and skeleton push-start track

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Stunt man David turns up with the 1976 toy that inspired his career. His Evel Knievel doll and Stunt World canyon jump is both complete and rare, and he hopes to use its nostalgic qualities to help him leap towards a stellar sale. Ashley appears with a hand-painted 6ft-long tuna that he wants to sell so he can buy a fibreglass gorilla. Michelle presents a mid-20th century chair linked to famous designer Ingmar Relling, which she bought from a junk shop for 15

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones co-hosts the live magazine show, featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Drastic times call for drastic measures for Stacey as the bills pile high, and Nish quizzes Suki about her time with Eve in Leeds. Amy is in trouble at home when she is caught trying to steal booze from Peggy's

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett face another selection of hopeful entrepreneurs. A duo offering activity-packed weekend breaks for adults turn one of the Dragons into an unhappy camper. Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Stacey Dooley: Ready for War?
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a few tiny specks of grey paint help to solve not one, but two, brutal axe murders. Plus, how a bungling burglar was caught when his DNA is discovered on a rock used to smash a window. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Thorn the giraffe is having problems with his hooves, but for the vet to get close enough to fix them he needs to be within kicking distance of the giant animal. Elsewhere in the park, another team of vets prepares to perform a procedure on a pair of male reindeer. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development progress of properties in Burnley and Lowestoft, as well as a Shropshire cottage that Martin Roberts has fallen in love with

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Nick Hall and Tim Weeks assist the red and blue teams as they shop for bargains in Detling, Kent. Presenter Caroline Hawley monitors the contest and also visits Bekonscot, the oldest model village in the world

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Al does something shocking to save his daughter's skin while the police are called out to investigate the vandalism of a remote cottage that belonged to Mrs Yorke only to discover Denis Crofter fixing the damage

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Bedford call on the help of interior designer Russell Sage and the Virtual Reality design studio for advice on how to resolve their differences on what to do with their new extension area, which is currently very white and uninspired

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor helps a Suffolk house-hunter with his quest to find a low-maintenance rural home with a wildlife-friendly garden, on a 490,000 budget. Margherita also turns her attention to the county's maritime heritage when she gets hands-on with traditional skills and techniques at Suffolk's International Boatbuilding Training College

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Peter appears with a 1960s battery-operated tin tugboat, hoping to captivate buyers with its performance. Nicola presents a vintage petrol pump restored by her father. This 1940s piece is in great condition and she uses this virtue to drive a hard bargain with the five dealers. Raj offers up a set of stylish and functional stools, while Rachel showcases two charming funfair dolphins. Nigel Havers hosts

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones co-hosts the live magazine show, featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits Arkverikie Estate in Inverness-shire, to witness how it is adapting to climate change by plugging in to renewable energy sources. Shahbaz Majeed is at Lochalsh to investigate how the arrival of electricity for the very first time in the 1940s, transformed people's lives - and the landscape. Anne Lundon heads to Bonar Bridge to help serve lunch and hear how a community caf and food hub are helping the community pull together through the energy crisis. Plus, Rosie Morton steps inside the home known as the Hobbit House and meets its creator

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Motsi Mabuse, Bez, Sarah Greene, Joe Wilkinson, Snoochie Shy, Lucy Martin, Anton Du Beke, Jo Brand, Steve Pemberton, Shazia Mirza, Lucy Beaumont, Tom Allen, Amol Rajan, Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and Morgana Robinson

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The first quarter-final sees this week's most talented four cooks return to contest a place in the semi-finals. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by last year's series finalists and champion, namely Eddie Scott, Pookie Tredell and Radha Kaushal-Bolland. Only the best cooks can earn themselves a place in knockout week, so these amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to the 2023 trophy

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Charlie Brooker hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with comedian Miles Jupp and journalist Charlotte Ivers acting as guest panellists alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. Collectively, all concerned poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a stately home for his latest cleaning task. He's not the only person at the mansion with a job to do - there's a shaman on the scene as well, and he has his own mystical agenda. Wicky's not sure there's room enough for both of them - and after an owl and possibly a ghost are factored into the mix, things are looking positively crowded. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Alex Lawther

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England striker Ellen White, world 1500m champion Jake Wightman, Grand National-winning former jockey Mick Fitzgerald and Olympic boxing medallist Anthony Ogogo join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: I Give It a Year (2013)
programme.desc: A couple marry after a whirlwind romance, but family and friends have doubts about the relationship. As their first anniversary approaches, they both begin to wonder if they are right for each other, especially when faced with more appealing alternative partners. Romantic comedy, with Rose Byrne, Rafe Spall, Anna Faris and Simon Baker

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting the ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates some easy celebration bakes, including a glittering meringue layer cake, a slow-cooked lamb curry fit for a feast, a traditional Eastern European sweet bread known as babka and an American inspired seafood extravaganza. She also meets award-winning macaron maker Naeem Mohamed, who shares his astonishing macaron stack cake

programme.title: The Agreement
programme.desc: Miriam O'Callaghan presents a documentary marking the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, examining the intense negotiations that led to the North's comprehensive political settlement in April 1998. The documentary also looks at the unprecedented referendum campaign when voters in Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland gave their verdict on the Agreement. With contributions from key figures including Tony Blair, Bertie Ahern and George Mitchell

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Peter appears with a 1960s battery-operated tin tugboat, hoping to captivate buyers with its performance. Nicola presents a vintage petrol pump restored by her father. This 1940s piece is in great condition and she uses this virtue to drive a hard bargain with the five dealers. Raj offers up a set of stylish and functional stools, while Rachel showcases two charming funfair dolphins. Nigel Havers hosts

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones co-hosts the live magazine show, featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm to Feast: Best Menu Wins
programme.desc: With three semi-finalists already confirmed, Michelin star chef Danni Barry and food critic Joris Minne enjoy a chance to see what's on the menu when the four remaining contestants are presented with award-winning venison from Baronscourt Estate and oyster mushrooms from a unique urban farm in east Belfast. The task is to turn them into a memorable menu for a mouth-watering meal - and that final place in the semi-final. Presented by Eamonn Holmes

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Motsi Mabuse, Bez, Sarah Greene, Joe Wilkinson, Snoochie Shy, Lucy Martin, Anton Du Beke, Jo Brand, Steve Pemberton, Shazia Mirza, Lucy Beaumont, Tom Allen, Amol Rajan, Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and Morgana Robinson

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The first quarter-final sees this week's most talented four cooks return to contest a place in the semi-finals. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by last year's series finalists and champion, namely Eddie Scott, Pookie Tredell and Radha Kaushal-Bolland. Only the best cooks can earn themselves a place in knockout week, so these amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to the 2023 trophy

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Charlie Brooker hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with comedian Miles Jupp and journalist Charlotte Ivers acting as guest panellists alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. Collectively, all concerned poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a stately home for his latest cleaning task. He's not the only person at the mansion with a job to do - there's a shaman on the scene as well, and he has his own mystical agenda. Wicky's not sure there's room enough for both of them - and after an owl and possibly a ghost are factored into the mix, things are looking positively crowded. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Alex Lawther

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Keepin' 'Er Country: On the Road Again
programme.desc: Robert Mizzell and Johnny Brady play the biggest country festival of the summer - the Cowboys and Heroes Festival in Co Leitrim - as fans travel from far and wide to enjoy the weekend. Such is his dedication to fitness, Johnny has invited his personal trainer to the festival with him, while Robert has his custom-built stars and stripes guitar to hand

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England striker Ellen White, world 1500m champion Jake Wightman, Grand National-winning former jockey Mick Fitzgerald and Olympic boxing medallist Anthony Ogogo join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: I Give It a Year (2013)
programme.desc: A couple marry after a whirlwind romance, but family and friends have doubts about the relationship. As their first anniversary approaches, they both begin to wonder if they are right for each other, especially when faced with more appealing alternative partners. Romantic comedy, with Rose Byrne, Rafe Spall, Anna Faris and Simon Baker

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Nathan Outlaw and Alison Roman, with special guest Nina Wadia. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates some easy celebration bakes, including a glittering meringue layer cake, a slow-cooked lamb curry fit for a feast, a traditional Eastern European sweet bread known as babka and an American inspired seafood extravaganza. She also meets award-winning macaron maker Naeem Mohamed, who shares his astonishing macaron stack cake

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including West Ham United v Arsenal. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Aston Villa and Newcastle United

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring Luca Brecel and Neil Robertson's first-round matches against qualifiers. Brecel has never progressed beyond the first round, while Robertson was a champion in 2010

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of this afternoon's results from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Dr Hilary Jones, TV presenter Danni Menzies, drag queen Kitty Scott-Claus and actor Niamh McGrady are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on the discovery of penicillin, rally driver Rosemary Smith, Girls Aloud, and Bluey

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as daytime TV stars Fern Britton, Owain Wyn Evans, Naga Munchetty, Charlie Stayt, Mr Motivator, Carol McGiffin, Diarmuid Gavin and Dr Punam Krishan try to win 50,000 for charity

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy quiz show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. With Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Mari Wilson, Jaki Graham, Ruthie Henshall, Kerry Ellis, Carrie Grant, David Grant, Nicola Stephenson and Charlie Condou try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jan is shocked to recognise a drunk and homeless patient suffering from trench foot as her ex-husband, and discovers to her horror that she is still listed as his next of kin. Max issues a challenge - whichever new nurse has the most impressive shift will win a prize - and Dylan accidentally makes Donna's life much harder when she comes to the aid of a patient collapsed in the car park

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan finds herself under pressure to make decisions about her future, as CityWorld need to know if she wants to be CEO but Andreas wants to go back to Crete. She is still determined to find the missing last chapter of Alan Conway's book, and her suspicions are further aroused about his untimely end

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Newcastle United at Villa Park and Manchester City v Leicester City. United continued their bid for a top-four place away to the mid-table Villans, while the Citizens will have expected three points to aid their title-challenge when they entertained struggling Leicester

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer present a countdown of some of the many fine French players to have graced the Premier League

programme.title: The Place Beyond the Pines (2012)
programme.desc: A motorcycle stunt rider is reunited with his lost love and the son he has never met. He gives up his life on the road to support them, but ends up drawn into crime, attracting the attention of a troubled, ambitious cop and setting in motion a conflict that will have unforeseen consequences for both men's children. Crime drama, starring Ryan Gosling and Bradley Cooper

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Ruben and Lewis have dreamt of having a place on the Formula 1 circuit for as long as they can remember. Theyve been racing since the age of four and have won hundreds of trophies between them. This year, they are stepping up a gear and entering a race that could make or break their careers. Breaking into motorsports isn't easy. Motor racing is an exceptionally expensive sport, with annual costs in the tens of thousands just for go-karting for cars, the sky is the limit. It is also notably lacking in diversity. Those financial and cultural barriers often stand in the way of new drivers coming onto the track. But Ruben and Lewiss fathers are dedicated to helping their sons achieve their dreams. They, and their families, are prepared to sacrifice everything to help them make it. Now, they are stepping up from racing in go-karts to securing seats in professional race cars. Its time for Ruben and Lewis to deliver on track, get themselves noticed and do their dads proud. programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief

programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.desc: The actor explores horses in history, travelling high into the Pyrenees mountains, where there is a record of the horse drawn on the walls of the Niaux Cave from 14,000 years ago. A hundred years ago, fishermen used horses to trawl the sea for shrimps, and Martin spends a day fishing with these last European horse fishermen. And in Dubai he visits the Meydan racecourse, the one place that still connects us with our equine past

And what is her hold on the people of Morton Fendle, a village still overshadowed by the gloomy spectre of the war? John Nettles and Jason Hughes star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A mischievous trickster finally gets his comeuppance when his body is found floating below the weir in Midsomer Deverell. The extent of his double life starts to emerge when three family friends and a long-lost niece produce wills claiming his fortune, and his collection of erotic photographs from the 1960s gives Barnaby and Jones the key to the tangled relationships and feuds blighting the family

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a family glassware business collapses following the death of one of its partners, Barnaby investigates allegations of financial irregularities, love triangles and a string of murders. Lapsed Freemason Jones uses his inside knowledge to explore the ceremonial aspects of two killings, but it is Cully's production of Hamlet that gives Tom the key to the mystery. John Nettles, Jason Hughes, Jane Wymark and Laura Howard star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A depressive gambler is found dead, the apparent victim of suicide. Dr Jane Moore, who once treated the man, is adamant he wouldn't have taken his own life - a theory backed up by the post-mortem. Thrilled to be working with Jane again, Barnaby investigates the case - and it isn't long before another of the doctor's patients is killed. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Isla Blair, Jan Ravens and Daniel Casey

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An aristocrat's wealthy, overbearing wife finances a North African archaeological dig to find the skull of John the Baptist. Poirot is in attendance, but when the woman is found stabbed to death, and only her husband, the exuberant Lord Boynton, appears distraught, the detective struggles to identify the killer among the wealth of suspects. Guest starring Tim Curry, Cheryl Campbell, John Hannah, Emma Cunniffe, Mark Gatiss, Angela Pleasence and Beth Goddard, with David Suchet in the title role

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The duo look into the murder of an eight-year-old boy, coming up against a paedophile who cruelly deceives his victim's family. Dom's HIV test comes back negative, so he sets out to celebrate - only to endanger his own life and jeopardise Rachel's sergeant's exam in the process. Janet tells Andy she is having second thoughts about their brief liaison, but he finds her decision hard to accept. Suranne Jones and Lesley Sharp star, with Liam Boyle, Nicholas Gleaves and Joe Duttine

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: All Access
programme.desc: Tony Khan gives fans an all-access pass to the world of AEW at a pivotal time for the company. The Young Bucks return after two months away, as Dr. Britt Baker aims to raise the profile of the women's division, while boyfriend Adam Cole battles to comeback from a severe concussion.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade enlists the supernatural help of a local witch doctor to catch the notorious goliath tigerfish in the Congo River in Central Africa. The creature has the biggest teeth of any freshwater species, and combines the strength, speed and ferocity of all the monsters Jeremy has encountered up to now, pushing him to his physical and mental limits

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade heads to Thailand in search of the giant freshwater stingray, one of the world's largest and most terrifying river fish. Fate seems to smile on the ambitious seafarer though, when he discovers the villainous Bonaparte has reneged on the treaty. programme.title: Tempting Fortune

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team tracks down fascinating facts from around the world related to the growing British tradition of savouring takeaway food, on which a billion pounds is spent a month. Jimmy Doherty is in Thailand to discover the unexpected addition in spring rolls. He then heads to India to find out the real reason takeaway curry can be so delicious - the mythical ingredient, ghee. Amanda Byram spills the beans on coffee and learns why some cups leave consumers more 'buzzing' than others. Andi Oliver has the meaty task of learning how doner kebabs are made and bags herself an invite to the fancy award ceremony known as the Kebaftas

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team take on their first prehistoric dig as they try to unearth ancient roundhouses in the village of Stretton in Staffordshire. Their mission is to work out just how far back in time the settlement dates - is it Bronze Age, Iron Age or from the early Romano British period? Nobody has ever excavated the site before, and for the first time the team dig up a school playing field
